# PTD Today Weekly Intelligence Brief  
**Date Range:** Last 7 days ending 2026-01-03

---

## 1) Top Themes  
- Offshore wind development and investment dynamics, including disputes and capacity growth  
- Solar industry trends: manufacturing, pricing, large project completions, and policy mandates  
- AI's emerging economic impact and applications in energy tech  
- Grid modernization and flexible connections for community solar  
- Critical infrastructure risks (subsea cable incident) impacting data center operations  

---

## 2) Top Stories  
- Orsted is legally challenging the U.S. government's halt on its $5 billion offshore wind project. (Source: Reuters)  
- China leads in offshore wind single-unit turbine capacity with Vestas installing a 15 MW turbine at offshore farms in 2025. (Source: offshorewind.biz)  
- Apollo Investments becomes co-owner of the Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm, signaling increased private sector involvement. (Source: offshorewind.biz)  
- UK solar market is poised for record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployments in 2026, supporting industry growth. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Tata Power Renewable completes a 1 GW DCR (Domestic Content Requirement) compliant photovoltaic project for SJVN in India. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- India mandates 20% domestic content for battery storage projects, aligning with localization goals. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  
- Finnish police seize a ship suspected of severing a subsea cable and detain the Russian crew, highlighting risks to data center connectivity. (Source: datacenterdynamics.com)  
- New digital twin technology for floating PV installations employing AI advances grid-scale solar management. (Source: pv-magazine.com)  

---
